com.gnahraf.io.store.ks

Class RollingKeystone

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gnahraf.io.store.ks.Keystone
      • com.gnahraf.io.store.ks.KeystoneImpl
        • com.gnahraf.io.store.ks.RollingKeystone
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Channel

    public class RollingKeystone
extends KeystoneImpl
    Manages reliable persistence of an 8 byte value to an I/O device. This is a slight improvement on KeystoneImpl's 2 cell design: it uses 3 cells in order to better lock down the keystone's behavior under rolling commits: it closes a data corruption vulnerability to abnormal shutdown when the calling code invokes either of increment(value, false) or put(value, false) (i.e. with the rollingCommit flag set to true) in succession (without having had forced a interleaving sync).

    Note

    I'm making this the standard type of persisted keystone: the 2 cell keystone (the base class) may still have its uses, but I made this the default implementation in Keystone.createInstance(FileChannel, long) and Keystone.createInstance(FileChannel, long, long).

    File Format

    This is serialized as a 25 byte sequence: three 8 byte wide cells followed by a special, byte-wide index cell. On the read path, the entire block is loaded, the index cell is consulted, and the relevant value of the indexed cell is returned.

    On the write path, the new value is first written to the next cell (determined in a round robin scheme), then the file is flushed, and finally the index cell is updated to point to the cell with the newly written value. 

     
  
 
     cell                        cell index (byte-size keystone)
   _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
  |    8    |         |         | |
  |  bytes  |         |         | |
   - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
 
  ^                             ^
  |                             |
  |        O F F S E T S        |
  |                             |
  |                             |
   `--- fileOffset               `--- fileOffset + 24
    Author:
    Babak

    • Method Detail

      • cellCount

        protected int cellCount()
        Description copied from class: KeystoneImpl
        Returns the number of cells (excluding the index cell) used by the implementation. This method is accessed once by the base class constructor and is left as a subclass override hook. Valid return values are in the range [2, 256].
        Overrides:
        cellCount in class KeystoneImpl
        Returns:
        3
